barrons:choices.barrons:choice: It is impossible to determine which quantity is greater.

question_content.barrons:explanation:
Quantity B is greater.

There are 900 3-digit integers (from 100 to 999). Of those, 400 begin with an even digit (the numbers in the 200s, 400s, 600s, and 800s); the other 500 begin with an odd digit. So it is likely that Quantity B is greater, and you should guess that if youâ€™re not sure.

In fact, by using the counting principle, you get that there are 4 × 5 × 5 = 100 3-digit integers with only even digits and 5 × 5 × 5 = 125 3-digit integers with only odd digits.
